explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 41degC (ICSC (2000)), which is classified into "Category 3." Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN#2227) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing unsaturated bonds (olefin). Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN#2227) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 290degC (ICSC, 1999).

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: No data available. Those containing stabilizers are classified into Class 3 (UN#2227) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 16,000mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 16,000mg/kg and 20,000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 11,300mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the rat LC50 (inhalation) value of 28.5mg/L (equivalent to 4,810ppm) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002)) exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (2,790ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 282Pa (25degC), the substance was considered as "mist exposure," and the obtained LC50 exceeded the upper limit value of Category 4 (5mg/L) by more than 2.5 fold.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (4 hour application) (CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002)): "Mild irritation."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests evaluated according to the Draize scheme (CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002)): "Mild irritation."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Classification not possible due to the insufficiency of data. No evidence of skin sensitization was observed in guinea pig skin sensitization tests evaluated according to Maximization Method and Split Adjuvant Method (CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002)), whereas PATTY (4th, 2001) and EU Risk Phrase (R43) suggest a potential for sensitization.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo, negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (micronucleus tests), described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1998), CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002) and NTP DB (Access on Mar., 2006).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of decreased numbers of corpora lutea and implantation sites observed at doses causing parental toxicity, described in Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1998) and CERI Hazard Data 2001-49 (2002).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "respiratory irritation" (ECETOC JACC36 (1996)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "atrophy of the red pulp of spleen" (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1998)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96 hours LC50=5570microg/L of the fish (Oryzias Latipest) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 88% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=2.88 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
